summary: Workflow execution sometimes fails to continue after an await condition with signals is satisfied, causing the workflow to hang indefinitely even after resending signals. The issue appears intermittently in production (~10% of cases) and couldn't be replicated in development environments.
userImpact: Workflows hang unexpectedly in production when waiting for signals, requiring manual intervention and preventing process execution from resuming even after signals are resent.
rootCause: Issue was in the Roadrunner (RR) version 2.10.2 and earlier, fixed in RR v2.10.3.
proposedFix: Update Roadrunner to v2.10.3 and SDK to v1.3.2.
resolutionDetails: Fixed in RR v2.10.3 and SDK v1.3.2. User confirmed stable operation after one week of running updated versions.
keyQuote: It has been nearly one week running RR v2.10.3 and sdk v1.3.2 with no issues. It seems the issue has been fixed.
